content: finishing off viking lay beard out for mustache  start at the center post take strands from the top center and bottom start to top french braid also known as a dutch braid across the top lip when you reach the side bring some of the 6 strands attached to the inner post stop pulling in new strands and braid to the bottom tie off with the same colour yarn attach band if desired see lower in pattern  repeat on the other side for middle  take all 3 strands from the top attachments from the top row of the lower base  complete a 5 plait braid to bottom tie off with same colour yarn and attach band if desired put beard on and then trim down each side from edge to center on an angle to give a more natural look be careful not to cut braids bands using grey or bronze yarn and g hook chain 9 r2 half_double_crochet 6 starting in 3rd chain from hook tie off and leave a long end wrap the band around the end of the braid and use the left over end to attach the ends of the band together as well as to attach the band to the braid wizard put beard on for mustache  trim mustache leaving the shortest pieces a bit longer than the bottom row of the top of the base for beard  trim down one side from the edge to the center on an angle repeat on other side to make a more natural look  if using two colours of yarn it is recommended to cut the pieces that lay on top slightly shorter than the bottom pieces to allow both colours to show through attaching to hat the base has two button holes on each side built into it to allow the beard to be attached and detached to a hat  place desired hat on head hold the beard to face in desired position mark were the button hole fall on the hat  take hat off and sew buttons onto the inside of the hat where marked push the buttons through the holes on the beard base
